I am a student learning back-end programming. But I'm also learning the front end. The languages we learn are mainly Java and JavaScript. I learned JSP and servlet as web application tools. It's been four months since I learned.
We are going to work on the web project by April 16th as a team of 5 people. The site we want to emulate is https://bxgs.co.kr/. What are some of the features of this site that we can implement?

Here are some of the features you can implement to emulate the website <https://bxgs.co.kr/>:

1. Responsive Design: The website should be optimized for different screen sizes and devices.
2. User Login and Registration: Allow users to create an account and log in to access certain features of the site.
3. Search Functionality: Implement a search function to allow users to search for specific products or information.
4. Product Listing: Display a list of products with images, descriptions, and pricing information.
5. Shopping Cart: Allow users to add products to their cart and view the total cost before checking out.
6. Payment Integration: Integrate a payment gateway to allow users to securely make purchases.
7. Order Management: Implement a system to manage and track orders, including order status and delivery information.
8. Product Review System: Allow users to leave reviews for products and display the average rating.
9. Responsive Customer Service: Implement a system for customers to contact the company for support and resolve any issues.
10. Admin Dashboard: Create a dashboard for administrators to manage the website, including adding/editing products, managing orders, and monitoring site traffic.

These are just a few examples of the features you can implement. Make sure to prioritize the most important features and work together as a team to bring the project to life.

We want to implement membership, login and logout, product search, product list, bulletin board (product reviews, work reviews, etc.), shopping cart, member information change, one-on-one inquiry, and purchase functions.
I'm going to use Oracle database to store data, so what tables do I need? Can you name each table?
 
 
 
 지금 번역하기

Sure! Here are the tables you'll need to store the data for the features you mentioned:

1. Members: This table will store information about registered users, including their username, password, email, and other personal information.
2. Products: This table will store information about the products available for purchase, including the product name, description, image, price, and availability.
3. Orders: This table will store information about the orders placed by customers, including the products purchased, the quantity, and the total cost.
4. Shopping Cart: This table will store information about the items in a customer's shopping cart, including the product ID, quantity, and total cost.
5. Product Reviews: This table will store customer reviews for each product, including the product ID, the reviewer's username, the review text, and a rating.
6. Work Reviews: This table will store customer reviews for the company's work, including the reviewer's username, the review text, and a rating.
7. Bulletin Board: This table will store posts made to the bulletin board, including the post text, the username of the poster, and the date and time of the post.
8. One-on-One Inquiry: This table will store information about customer inquiries, including the customer's username, the inquiry text, and the date and time of the inquiry.
9. Member Information Changes: This table will store information about changes made to a customer's personal information, including the customer's username, the field that was changed, and the new value.

These are the minimum tables you'll need to store the data for the features you mentioned. Depending on the complexity of your project, you may need to create additional tables to store related data.
